text:
\[
\sec A - (\sin A)(\tan A) = \frac{1}{\cos A} - \sin A \cdot \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} = \frac{1 - \sin^2 A}{\cos A} = \frac{\cos^2 A}{\cos A} = \cos A
\]
class-1-reason: Simplifying the expression in the denominator.
class-2-reason: Performs algebraic simplification to reduce the expression sec A - (sin A)(tan A).

class-1-reason: Transitioning to the next step after simplifying a part of the expression
class-2-reason: States the next step based on the previous simplification.

text:
\[
(\tan A)(\sec A - (\sin A)(\tan A)) = \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \cdot \cos A = \sin A
\]
class-1-reason: Simplifying the expression in the denominator.
class-2-reason: Calculates the simplified form of the denominator.

class-1-reason: Preparing to simplify the entire function after working on the denominator.
